reviewText:
This game had a rough start with me. I bought it with the intent on doing co-op and it went horribly!

First, I couldnt figure how to set P1/2 to mouse+kb or controller (turns out you cant, it detects a controller ONLY if its powered on before launching the game AND it wont let you assign who is using it - its given to P1). Once we finally got going, we were almost immediately frustrated with the loot and xp system, having only 1 person with a stick and only the person killing gets the xp! We left it there, as it seemed to be one thing after another done badly...

I decided to give it another try myself at some point and I am glad that I did. While there are some issues, Ive enjoyed getting into the game (just finished the main story as of writing this).

While this is a good game, it could so easily be a great game if a few changes were made. There is no storage (fair enough, its a survival game!), instead you need to drop things on the ground, they dont appear to despawn, the problem is, if you are playing with breaks between sessions, you probably wont remember where a certain component that you need was left and with limited inventory space and without knowing what items are really going to be useful or needed next, you often have to drop things. This could have easily been addressed by allowing notes to be added to the map, lets face it, if you're trying to be real about it and all that stood between you being able to craft a weap was some tubing, you would remember where you put it!! Since Im not in a life and death situation (irl!), rather sitting on a chair with a controller in my hand and this item was dropped in a game somewhere last week, it stands to reason I may not recall ^^ This ONE change would really lift this game.

As for the co-op, it needs to be tweaked to reflect there are 2 people playing (as it is, you are left playing the very same game as the single player, loot/mob count/exp/everything). 4 Things that would have made for a far better experience for co-op
1) A little more slack on the camera (even solo the odd time it gets rather close and pointed downward, with 2 people having to share an already unforgiving view space....)
2) Shared xp, straight up split down the middle - always - for everyone - always.
3) Minor adjustment of available starting loot. It takes from the experience when one person can do nothing, doesnt matter if its only" for 5 mins or 20 mins
date: it just isnt fun and shouldnt be this way.\n4) A more forgiving hit box for your partner. Just swinging a stick I found it easier to hit my partner than the zombie! Even if it appeared on my screen I was pointing at the zombie and it was slightly closer
recommended: I either hit only my partner or both! Whether it was lag
hoursPlayed: or just crappy hit box.\n\nI could do a rant about the dlc decisions (some weather effects not included in base game :O!!)
voteText: I wont say more! I got it nicely discounted and Ive gotten my moneys worth."

reviewText:
Well, yes - H2S has it's problems, mainly in the clumsy user interface regarding any inventory actions. And yes, it will get repetetive after a while. And yes, you will max out your character pretty fast, after which the surviving aspect of the game becomes pretty much a walk in the park. BUT. Doing all this is pretty charming, rather mindless fun. Nice looking surroundings plus rather different outtake and feel of zombie survivalism compared to the competition make it well worth your time and money. At least if you enjoy Diablo-esque light-RPG-hack'n'slash sort of affair.

I've seen some reviews around complaining about juvenile and absurd humour. Each to his or her own; talking parrots with absurd quests, t-shirt wearing silly monkeys and heavy accented welder-masked half-lunatic made me chuckle a few times. When not chuckling, I've been having loads of fun with the insta-kill death animations, blowing heads, scattering limbs and blasting all kinds of zombie humans and animals with bolts and nuts.

At the moment I'm struggling to keep my interest up in retrieving last 5 of the 20 packages to a drunken latino aviator, which tends to be repetitive pain in the ♥♥♥, but I can't wait to get it done and get on with hopefully some more exciting aspects of the adventure. hen that's done, there'll be Horno isles to be conquered. And after that, there will be the challenges which I really look forward to, co-op playing-wise. People ith crispier playing pace will have probably about 10  hours worth gaming time ahead of them, with my snail-paced completism you can double or triple that easily.

reviewText: You're trapped on an island full of zombies and other creatures. Your only chance is to cobble together various ludicrous weapons from junk laying around the island and FIGHT! With the help of the mysterious stranger Kovac (complete with strange European accent), you'll fabricate ad-hoc armor from pieces of tire and guns from scuba tanks and flared pipes. You can make all kinds of gear. The combat physics make the game a blast -- if you have the time to aim carefully you can get head hits, but body hits can knock zombies back or spin them around to buy you time to take more careful aim. This game is a really fun!

reviewText:
Edit: Updated with DLC:

I've read a  few negative reviews left for HTS and I think they miss the point: Killing Zombies in this game is great fun. That's what zombie games should be right? The game is easily worth the $5 or less you can usually get it for on sale.

The simple story and its minor twist was enough to keep things going. Crafting is a fun and there is enough reward to make this worthwhile. It was also great fun playing local co-op where you have to be careful not to shoot each other while being onset by a hoard. The challenge modes are great fun after you finish (you get to keep armour you earned in the game for this) - again even better in co-op.

PROS
+ Zombie Killing - fun!
+ Good Powerups
+ Nice Design overall
+ Graphics, Sound and Animations are decent
+ Good tension at times but without being too stressful.

NEGS
- It gets quite repetitive at times.
- Small environments (islands are not very big).
- The inventory size is many a tad limited which means even more wandering back to places to get things you need.
- Frame rate drops suddenly on occasion and needs reboot.
- Occasional crashes (but game does get saved automatically quite often).
- Switching ammo type is a real pain (no quick toggle button).
- Map should show where you dropped stuff. Too hard finding things you already found!
- Terrible Spelling!!! Not a dealbreaker but so many typos!!
- Diablo Islands achievments are way too hard. I had S-Ranked this game before the DLC but now I can't get that back despite 50+ hours work.

This is a fun game and great value for money.

Overall I give it an easy 7.7/10

reviewText:
I literally loved this game so much, already completed it and did a few side quests as well.

It's a perfect surival game, you spend time filling up jerry cans with water and gasoline, watching your thirst, hunger and tiredness levels dropping gradually, searching for food and combining items together to make awesome weapons, potions and armour.

The melee combat is not as satisfying as the ranged combat but the ranged combat is so satisfying. I must admit when it first started I thought it was a bit tedious and boring but once it got started I was totally addicated.

If it's not your type of genre then you probably just won't like it but if survival type genres are you will love this!

Also I got this for about £1.50 on offer - best money I ever spent. My only grievance is just as I was realllllly getting into it, I completed it. Gutted - but now i'll just buy number 2 and 3 haha

reviewText:
I bought How to Survive on sale - the screen shots and video of the game intrigued me, reminded me like Diablo but not as complex and not as long.

This game was a very pleasant surprise, stunning graphics - nice touches like foam on the rolling waves, hordes of zombies (woot !), skill tree, and the ability to mix items to come up with new items.

I also like the fact that you get to choose your character, and that the choices are just limited to some brainless brute - I am glad they included a female character.

I also liked how they included basic items like sleep, thirst, and hunger, which added new element to the game.  The quests, while at times can be a grind, was a blast to play.

My only minor issue is that the game is short, but nonetheless enjoyable.

reviewText:
Awesome game but very very short, and it has also ♥♥♥♥♥♥ me off more than once :)

I bought this game after a friend recommended it, ive just got into these hack n slash diablo style games and enjoy co-op gameplay. This game is fun but short, it has a very nice crafting system which gets dry after a while with a lack of items to craft and once you have reached the final island you have pretty much found everything you can craft and you'll find yourself just throwing random items away because you'll never ever use them again.

This game can be challenging if you dont prepare yourself, there is a lack of health on this game and it can be quite hard to find the health plants, but certain food types provide you with small health boosts which help but dont stop you getting your ♥♥♥ handed to you later in the game.

I have played about 3 hours of single player and the rest of the time played is co-op story mode, both seem just as fun as each other, but co-op has some down sides that i wasnt liking much. When given quests by one of the various monkeys on the islands you go off on said quests and complete that return to the monkey and he hands you a reward, BUT! only one player gets the reward and thats always the host of the game :( it would be nice to both receive a reward being as we BOTH took time to complete the quest. Also this game ♥♥♥♥♥♥ me off on one of the monkey quests upon completion i returned to the monkey for him to reward me with some modded ammo, after the monkey finished talking my character model was frozen to the spot for about 5 seconds and no controls or menu functions worked at all the game hadnt frozen just player input wasnt working for this short time, when play resumed my modified boomerang was gone from my inventory and no where to be found, i wouldnt complain its easy to make another but this one had a red stone added to it so its a quality weapon and the game just removed it completely from my inventory as if it never existed so that ♥♥♥♥♥♥ me off.

Anyway back to the game itself, its short and by short i mean very short i have completed it and done nearly every single quest im lacking 1 herb out of the 20 in the game and i think thats all i have to do to 100% it, the survival aspect of the game is a little lackluster, you just eat, drink and sleep when needed and ceratin plants you find during the game kind of make the survival side a bit laughable you have 4 things to keep an eye on, health, food, water, and sleep. Health is a struggle sometimes if you cant find the right food or the right plant to replenish your health, food isnt so much of an issue because you can eat certain plants and kill various animals and cook the meat from them to replenish your health, water was no issue at all for me i filled a gallon tank of water which provided me with 3 drinks and if you boil it over the fire each drink fills your meter back up and to refill the gallon tank you just go to a well which there are plenty and stock up. Sleep is probably the annoying one at first you have to take over safe houses to be able to sleep and this can get challenging as you progress in the game with bigger and stronger waves of zombies attacking each time you open a new safehouse and you cannot save or sleep until all zombies have been defeated, so this can make finding somewhere to sleep and chore, but each safe house has some nice items inside.

There is a load of loot to be found in this game and crafting items is a fun feature but is lacking in variety, the skills tree is quite poor and it does not give you much freedom in regards to customising your character to how you want to play its one of those skill trees where you have to upgrade certain things otherwise youll have issues finding certain items in the game etc its nothing bad but its nothing good either.

Gameplay, this is fun nice controls for PC also uses gamepad (xbox 360) and both work well, menus are simple and easy to use. Weapons are fun to craft and the sounds are awesome. The gameplay can feel repetetive with the lack of enemy variety but its still challenging and entertaining, the only character i can say i like was Kovac the survival expert his books he leaves around the islands have some funny cutscenes but thats where the game lacks in character attachement you dont really care for any character on the game and the voice acting for 99% of the characters is shockingly naff. But that don't make the game any less fun to play.

If you can get it cheap and want something to play that wont take all day and has co-op/multiplayer features and a little crafting on the side, plus is filled with zombies then this is the game for you. If you like diablo and you like zombies, and you liked dead island again this is the game for you.

i would give it 7/10, it was fun and a challenge at times but i cannot see me replaying it again now i have completed it as it was a little slow, and too noticeably repetetive far too often. The crafting system was a nice novelty featurem graphically its nice to look at, but character depth is lacking and enemy variety could of been better.

TBD"

date: but seeing an item labeled "TBD"\n\nI don't think I have the Diablo DLC
hoursPlayed:

Short:

Buy it for Co-Op.
Expect Bugs

It's fun

reviewText: This game is really good. When i bought it and had a look at the screenshots i wasn't really impressed, however the gameplya and the use of imagiation in the game have really brought it together. I like this game alot. Its one of those games that you need a friend to play with to be able to have more fun than what you usually would. I like how its no first person- there are too many games liek that. Thats what this game brings. A difference. I want to say that the online system is good, however the connection between players is poor as me and my friend at first found it a little hard to roam around with all of the stoapges needed to be made. I also don't like the quick constant spawn of zombies that appear as soon as you leave an area. There should be a bigger spawn time. But I like the crafting system and hunting system in the game. If i had to rate this, It would be 9/10 for the online and 10/10 for the game experience.

reviewText: Surprisingly, I've now spent a lot more hours on this game than other games on my list. Quite engaging crafting makes the gameply interesting. You will also want to explore to find good items which adds more into what makes the whole package of the game work. Only annoyance I find is that you do have to walk around to travel the different islands, since not everything is available on one island. Really, you will be spending a good amount of time walking around because apparently, the boats can only go a specific docks instead of allowing you to use one boat to travel to all visited islands. These docks are usually far apart, and you'll have to maze through the islands just to travel from island to island. That's probably the only annoyance that I've found. Story-wise, it's pretty ok. I've only played one character, and I can only guess that each character has their own story path to follow. As to what most reviewers can note, the crafting system for items you pickup is the bloodline of this game. Most story quest do require you to craft, and at a certain point, there's no reference for an item you needed to craft and you'll need to use your imagination (or google) to figure out what you needed to craft. 7/10

reviewText:
Fun, casual, laid-back isometric zombie shooter with a fairly decent crafting system. Story and dialogue are a little lacking, many elements are old and overused (what can you expect from another zombie survival game?), and there's not a whole lot of replayability, but nonetheless, it's definitely a great little game worth the price if you're looking for a cheap(ish), quick buy.

Oh, and Kovac is a boss.

8/10
